instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3437 Liquid Damage
threads.message:
Hi Guys, I have a liquid damaged 820-3437, liquid around U1900. Trace from C1910 to U1900 was burned so I made a new line. GOt arange and green light, fan spins for a few seconds and stops. CPU gets warm. Below all readings. The rest of the board all looks OK, also near U1950 and SMC. Suggestions?

PPBUS_G3H  =   8.6 
PP3V42_G3H =   3.42
PP5V_S5 = 5v
PP5V_S4 = pulsing 0-5v
PP3v3_S5  = 3.34
PP3v3_S4  =  3.34 pulsing
PPVCC_S0_CPU = pulsing
ALL_SYS_PWRGD = pulsing
PM_S0_PGOOD on U1950 = pulsing
SMC_LID = 3.42
SMC_ONOFF_L = 3.42
SMC Adapter Enable = 3.33 pulsing

threads.title: 820-3437 Liquid Damage
threads.message:
You do know these boards do the 3 times on/off before booting? 
CPU Vcore at 1.75V?

threads.title: 820-3437 Liquid Damage
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 25686"]You do know these boards do the 3 times on/off before booting?
CPU Vcore at 1.75V? [/QUOTE]

Yep I do know that.

CPU Vcore comes up to 1.735 and then drops with the spinning fan to 0

threads.title: 820-3437 Liquid Damage
threads.message: But does it do the 3 times thing? Does CPU Vcore stay on after that?

threads.title: 820-3437 Liquid Damage
threads.message: No it just spins for a second, or 2, and then stops and voltage drops to 0

threads.title: 820-3437 Liquid Damage
threads.message: When it does the 3 x spin it spins for a bit longer usually. Looks like its turning on and off.

threads.title: 820-3437 Liquid Damage
threads.message: So it turns on and after 2 seconds it turns off and stays off?

threads.title: 820-3437 Liquid Damage
threads.message:
No its powercycling, its a bit more then 2 seconds i counted 4 and then it stops. So it looks like the 3 x spin before boot, but it keeps doing that it does not turn off and doesnt boot either. As mentioned CPU gets hot so that seems to work.

PS sorry for the slow reply im working a number of other boards at the same time and this one is a no rush job :).

threads.title: 820-3437 Liquid Damage
threads.message: U6100 termination resistors and traces are the most likely
